title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Chest of Drawers", February 23, 1937
medium: Graphite, red, blue color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 8567/F.S./ANDERSON, OLSSON/DILLMANN/D./ 2/23/37, 3/3/37, 1, MASTERCR.; inscribed in graphite, lower right: CHEST 66" LONG 18" DEEP - 36" HIGH./WHITE SYCAMORE -POLLARD OAK BASE/INTERIORS WHITE SYCAMORE/FOUR DRAWERS ON LEFT SIDE WITH CENTRE DRAWER GUIDES/TWO DOORS ON RIGHT SIDE/BEHIND DOORS, FIVE DRAWERS ON EXT. SLIDES/DOORS TO HAVE SPEC. STRONG HINGES - BULLET CATCHES/PROVIDE STOPPERS FOR ALL DRAWERS/VENEER ALL EXPOSED EDGES & TOP EDGES OF DRAWERS & DOORS/PULLS : GLASS & POL CHROM./USE DOMES OF SILENCE; dimensions, instructions, materials in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for sideboard for Anderson house. Rectangular sideboard/chest of drawers in white sycamore, with low, rectangular base in pollard oak. Four narrow stacked drawers on left with long horizontal pulls. Two-door cabinet on right right with two vertical pulls.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Chest of Drawers", February 23, 1937.
February 23, 1937. Graphite, red, blue color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-963.
